snippet: While the American medical system is famous for expensive drugs and heroic care at the end of life, a more significant factor in the nation’s annual health care bill may be the high price tag of ordinary services.
abstract: Vast difference in prices of relatively common medical procedures like colonoscopies in the United States as opposed to other countries helps explain why US is far and away the world leader in medical spending; Americans pay more for almost every interaction with the medical system than citizens of other countries, even though numerous studies have concluded that Americans do not get better care (Series: Paying Till It Hurts).
lead_paragraph: While the American medical system is famous for expensive drugs and heroic care at the end of life, a more significant factor in the nation’s annual health care bill may be the high price tag of ordinary services.

headline.seo: Colonoscopies Explain Why U.S. Leads the World in Health Expenditures
